title: Calories in Scrambled Eggs
meta_description: Learn calories in eggs scrambled for a 2-egg serving, with protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition facts, and easy tweaks for your recipe.
assumptions: Two large eggs (~50 g each) scrambled with 1 tsp butter total, no added salt, milk, or cheese.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, added fats, cooking method, and ingredients; check labels or recipes for precision.

quick_answer.text: Two scrambled eggs provide ~182 kcal and ~13 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in eggs scrambled for 2 eggs?
faqs.a: About 182 kcal for two large scrambled eggs with minimal butter.

faqs.q: What is the protein in scrambled eggs?
faqs.a: Two scrambled eggs have ~13 g protein.

faqs.q: Do scrambled eggs have a lot of fat?
faqs.a: Yes, ~13.6 g total fat for two eggs, mostly from the yolks and added butter.

faqs.q: How does adding milk affect calories in eggs scrambled?
faqs.a: Adds ~10 kcal total for 2 tbsp, plus minor carbs and protein.

faqs.q: Are scrambled eggs higher in calories than boiled?
faqs.a: Yes, due to added fats like butter; plain scrambled is ~91 kcal per egg vs. 78 for boiled.
